questions.article: Sarah Marquis, who walked 16,000 kilometers across Asia, Siberia, and Australia, undoubtedly accomplished much, but to ______ a lasting historical legacy for oneself, almost nothing is more effective than being the first to do something. For example, people will always remember that Anesia Pinheiro Machado was the first female pilot in Brazil to carry passengers and the first to make stunt flights.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?
questions.solution:
翻译：
莎拉・马奎斯徒步穿越亚洲、西伯利亚和澳大利亚，行程达 16000 公里，无疑成就斐然，但要为自己____一份不朽的历史功绩，几乎没有什么比成为首个做某事的人更有效了。例如，人们会永远记得阿内西亚・皮涅罗・马查多是巴西首位搭载乘客的女飞行员，也是首位进行特技飞行的女飞行员。
  1. 以下哪个选项能以最符合逻辑且精确的单词或短语补全文本？
解析：
  • A 选项 “recognize” ：意为 “认出；识别；认可” ，“recognize a lasting historical legacy” 意思是认可一份历史功绩，而原文强调的是去创造、打造一份历史功绩，并非认可，该选项不符合语境。
  • B 选项 “undermine” ：表示 “破坏；削弱” ，“undermine a lasting historical legacy” 是破坏一份历史功绩，与原文想要表达的创造历史功绩的意思相悖，该选项错误。
  • C 选项 “constrain” ：意思是 “限制；约束” ，“constrain a lasting historical legacy” 这种搭配不符合原文语境，原文不是说限制历史功绩。
  • D 选项 “establish” ：有 “建立；确立” 的意思，“establish a lasting historical legacy” 即确立一份不朽的历史功绩，符合原文语境，是为自己打造、建立历史功绩的意思。
综上，正确答案是 D。

questions.article: The swordfish can swim very fast—up to 97 kilometers per hour (km/hr)—but it is significantly slower than the frigate bird, which can fly at speeds up to 153 km/hr. The difference between these speeds is largely ______ of the fact that the features that make flight possible do less to limit top speeds than the features suitable for swimming through water.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?
questions.solution:
翻译：
剑鱼游泳速度非常快，可达每小时 97 公里，但它比军舰鸟的速度慢很多，军舰鸟飞行速度可达每小时 153 公里。这两种速度的差异在很大程度上是____这样一个事实：使飞行成为可能的身体特征对最高速度的限制，要比适合在水中游泳的身体特征小。
解析：
  • A 选项 “a consequence” ：意为 “结果；后果” 。文中提到的速度差异是由于飞行和游泳的身体特征对速度限制不同导致的，速度差异是结果，所以“a consequence of”（…… 的结果）符合这种因果关系的表达，即速度差异是身体特征对速度限制不同的结果 。
  • B 选项 “an explanation” ：是 “解释” 的意思。如果是 “an explanation of” ，是用后面内容解释前面的事物，而这里是前面的速度差异是后面事实导致的结果，逻辑不符。
  • C 选项 “a repudiation” ：表示 “拒绝；否认” ，放入文中 “a repudiation of the fact”（对事实的否认），与原文想要表达的因果关系毫无关联，不符合语境。
  • D 选项 “an objective” ：意思是 “目标；目的” ，“an objective of the fact”（事实的目标）这种表达在文中说不通，不符合逻辑。
综上，正确答案是 A。

questions.article: Whether the reign of a French monarch such as Louis VII or Henry V was historically consequential or relatively uneventful, its trajectory was shaped by questions of legitimacy and therefore cannot be understood without a corollary understanding of the characteristics without which the monarch would have been forced to ______ the throne.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the precise word or phrase?
questions.solution:
翻译：
无论是路易七世还是亨利五世这样的法国君主的统治，在历史上是意义重大还是相对平淡，其统治轨迹都受到合法性问题的影响。因此，如果不相应地理解他统治的某些特性（没有这些特性君主将被迫____王位），就无法理解其统治。
解析：
  • A 选项 “reciprocate” ：意思是 “回报； reciprocate” ，“reciprocate the throne” 这种表达在文中语义不通，不符合语境。
  • B 选项 “annotate” ：意为 “注释；作注解” ，“annotate the throne” 无法与原文逻辑匹配，不能表达君主和王位之间的合理关系。
  • C 选项 “abandon” ：表示 “放弃；遗弃” ，“abandon the throne” 即 “放弃王位” ，符合文中提到的没有某些特性君主就会被迫放弃王位的逻辑。
  • D 选项 “equalize” ：意思是 “使相等；使平衡” ，“equalize the throne” 在文中没有合理的语义，不符合要求。
综上，正确答案是 C

questions.article: The Caves of Gargas paintings—stencils of human hands found in what is now France and dating from around 27,000 years ago—are thought of as art today, but the question of whether the people of the time understood the paintings as something akin to art in modern sense or in some other way entirely is ______: we will never be able to answer it.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?
questions.solution:
翻译：
加尔加斯洞穴壁画 —— 在现今法国境内发现的、距今约 27000 年的人手模板画 —— 如今被视为艺术，但当时的人们是否将这些画作理解为类似于现代意义上的艺术，还是完全从其他角度理解，这个问题是____：我们永远无法解答。
解析：
  • A 选项 “irresolvable” ：意思是 “无法解决的；不能解答的” 。文中明确提到 “we will never be able to answer it（我们永远无法解答）” ，说明这个问题是无法解决的，“irresolvable” 符合语境。
  • B 选项 “self-contradictory” ：意为 “自相矛盾的” 。原文并没有体现出问题存在自相矛盾的特点，所以该选项不符合。
  • C 选项 “imperative” ：表示 “至关重要的；迫切的” 。但文中强调的是问题无法回答，而非问题的重要性或迫切性，该选项不合适。
  • D 选项 “unavoidable” ：意思是 “不可避免的” 。这里说的是问题无法解答，和不可避免没有关系，该选项也不正确。
综上，正确答案是 A

questions.article:
The following text is adapted from William Wordsworth's 1798 poem "Lines Written a Few Miles above Tintern Abbey.”

Once again
Do I behold these steep and lofty cliffs,
Which on a wild secluded scene impress
Thoughts of more deep seclusion; and connect
The landscape with the quiet of the sky.
questions.question: As used in the text, what does the word "deep" most nearly mean?
questions.solution:
翻译：
以下文字改编自威廉・华兹华斯 1798 年的诗作《丁登寺旁杂咏》。
我再次
凝望这些陡峭高耸的悬崖，
它们在一片荒僻幽静的景色中
唤起更为幽僻的思绪；并将
这风景与天空的宁静相连。
5. 在文中，“deep” 一词最接近以下哪个意思？
解析：
在诗中 “deep seclusion” 描述的是一种程度很深的幽僻状态。
  • A 选项 “Tough” ：意为 “艰难的；坚韧的” ，与 “幽僻” 的语义毫无关联，不符合语境。
  • B 选项 “Hideous” ：表示 “可怕的；丑恶的” ，和诗中表达的幽僻之意不相关，该选项错误。
  • C 选项 “Complicated” ：意思是 “复杂的” ，诗中并非强调幽僻是复杂的，不符合语义。
  • D 选项 “Intense” ：有 “强烈的；极度的” 意思，“intense seclusion” 能体现出程度很深的幽僻，与诗中 “deep seclusion” 想要表达的程度深的幽僻语义相符。
综上，正确答案是 D

questions.article: Though many ______ studies of the effect of altitude on blood chemistry focus on people who live above sea level, researchers Suleiman Al-Sweedan and Moath Alhaj recently chose the novel path of focusing on people who live below sea level, in locations such as the California towns of Salton City and Coachella.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?
questions.solution:
翻译：
尽管许多关于海拔对血液化学成分影响的____研究都聚焦于生活在海平面以上的人群，但研究人员苏莱曼・阿尔 - 斯威丹和莫阿斯・阿尔哈杰最近选择了一条新颖的路径，聚焦于生活在海平面以下的人群，比如加利福尼亚州的索尔顿城和科切拉镇。
6. 以下哪个选项能以最符合逻辑且精确的单词或短语补全文本？
解析：
  • A 选项 “eccentric” ：意思是 “古怪的；异常的” 。如果说许多古怪的研究聚焦于海平面以上人群，与后文 “novel path（新颖路径）” 对比不恰当，因为 “古怪” 并非是与 “新颖” 相对的常规概念 。
  • B 选项 “meager” ：意为 “贫乏的；不足的” 。文中未提及研究的丰富程度相关内容，用 “贫乏的” 来形容研究不契合语境。
  • C 选项 “conventional” ：表示 “传统的；常规的” 。与后文研究人员选择的 “新颖路径” 形成鲜明对比，说明以往很多传统研究关注海平面以上人群，而这次研究另辟蹊径，符合逻辑。
  • D 选项 “random” ：意思是 “随机的” 。文中没有信息表明之前的研究是随机进行的，该选项不符合语境。
综上，正确答案是 C。

questions.article:
Text 1

The poet Audre Lorde once claimed that poetry is the most inexpensive of art forms to practice. While people who pursue other art forms—sculpture, architecture, long-form prose—require large blocks of uninterrupted time as well as money to complete their work, poets can write, as Lorde said, "between shifts, in the hospital pantry, on the subway, and on scraps of surplus paper." So poets can make worthwhile art even if they must earn their living in another way.

Text 2

Any assessment of the state of contemporary poetry must reckon with the professionalization of the field. While it is possible in theory for anyone to publish in Virginia Quarterly Review, Kenyon Review, or a similar major poetry outlet, many people who do so have professional training in poetry and extensive practice writing it, which requires time not often available to those who must also work full-time jobs. Thus, financial security indirectly affects which people become poets.
questions.question: Based on the texts, how would Lorde (Text 1) most likely respond to the argument presented in Text 2?

options.name: A
options.content: By indicating that those poets who publish in major poetry journals are most likely to be able to earn a living by writing poetry.

options.name: B
options.content: By pointing out that people can produce valuable poetry in other circumstances than those described by the author of Text 2.

options.name: C
options.content: By suggesting that those artists who specialize in more financially rewarding artistic forms are unlikely to also be successful as poets.

options.name: D
options.content: By asserting that people often work full-time jobs in order to afford the professional training described in Text 2.

questions.correct: By pointing out that people can produce valuable poetry in other circumstances than those described by the author of Text 2.
questions.solution:
A 选项 “通过指出那些在主要诗歌期刊上发表作品的诗人最有可能靠写诗谋生。”
B 选项 “通过指出人们可以在不同于文本 2 作者所描述的情况下创作出有价值的诗歌。”
C 选项 “通过暗示那些专注于经济回报更高的艺术形式的艺术家不太可能成为成功的诗人。”
D 选项 “通过断言人们经常为了负担文本 2 中描述的专业训练而从事全职工作。”
洛德在文本 1 中强调诗人可以在各种非理想条件下创作，而文本 2 强调专业训练和经济保障对成为诗人的影响。洛德最有可能回应说人们可以在不同于文本 2 所描述的条件下创作出有价值的诗歌，B 选项正确。

questions.article: The Yellow Admiral, first published in 1996, is a novel in Patrick O'Brian's Aubrey/Maturin series, which includes twenty books plus an unfinished fragment of a twenty-first. Like the rest of the books in the series, The Yellow Admiral has a rather abrupt ending, but the following book, The Hundred Days, picks up neatly where The Yellow Admiral leaves off. Thus, the sudden ending is only an issue if one considers the books as independent texts—the Aubrey/Maturin series is best thought of as a single incredibly long work, similar to other multivolume stories, such as Marcel Proust's In Search of Lost Time.
questions.question: Which choice best states the main idea of the text?

options.name: A
options.content: Over time, the Aubrey/Maturin series has acquired the same eminence among critics as works like In Search of Lost Time that have similar structures.

options.name: B
options.content: A certain understanding of the structures of the novels in the Aubrey/Maturin series is helpful if one wishes to appreciate the series.

options.name: C
options.content: Many readers find the Aubrey/Maturin novels to be remarkably entertaining despite flaws in the novels' structures.

options.name: D
options.content: The Yellow Admiral and The Hundred Days are two of the most complex of O'Brian's novels due in part to their unconventional structures.

questions.correct: A certain understanding of the structures of the novels in the Aubrey/Maturin series is helpful if one wishes to appreciate the series.
questions.solution:
A 选项 “随着时间的推移，奥布里 / 马图林系列在评论家中获得了与《追忆似水年华》等结构相似的作品相同的卓越地位。”
B 选项 “如果想要欣赏奥布里 / 马图林系列小说，对其小说结构有一定的了解是有帮助的。”
C 选项 “许多读者发现奥布里 / 马图林系列小说尽管结构有缺陷，但非常有趣。”
D 选项 “《黄色海军上将》和《百日王朝》是奥布莱恩小说中结构最复杂的两部，部分原因是它们非传统的结构。”
文章重点强调了将奥布里 / 马图林系列视为一个整体来理解其结构的重要性，B 选项符合文章主旨。

questions.article:
The following text is from Mary Shelley's 1818 novel Frankenstein. Victor Frankenstein, who narrates this portion of text, describes the state of scientific knowledge as he began his own study of the natural world.

The untaught peasant beheld the elements around him and was acquainted with their practical uses. The most learned philosopher knew little more. He had partially unveiled the face of Nature, but her immortal lineaments were still a wonder and a mystery. He might dissect, anatomize, and give names; but, not to speak of a final cause, causes in their secondary and tertiary grades were utterly unknown to him. I had gazed upon the fortifications and impediments that seemed to keep human beings from entering the citadel of nature, and rashly and ignorantly I had repined.
questions.question: Which choice best describes the main idea of the text?

options.name: A
options.content: Victor became disappointed in science when he realized that the practical knowledge laypeople have of nature is often deeper than the scientific understanding.

options.name: B
options.content: Victor was impressed by the layperson's practical understanding of nature but thought science provided a clearer understanding.

options.name: C
options.content: Victor was immediately impressed by the advantages of the scientific approach to understanding natural phenomena.

options.name: D
options.content: Victor thinks that conventional scientific approaches to understanding natural phenomena will not yield the answers he seeks.

questions.correct: Victor thinks that conventional scientific approaches to understanding natural phenomena will not yield the answers he seeks.
questions.solution:
A 选项 “当维克多意识到普通人对自然的实际知识往往比科学理解更深刻时，他对科学感到失望。”
B 选项 “维克多对普通人对自然的实际理解印象深刻，但认为科学能提供更清晰的理解。”
C 选项 “维克多立即对理解自然现象的科学方法的优势印象深刻。”
D 选项 “维克多认为传统的科学方法无法找到他所寻求的答案。”
文中维克多提到科学虽然有一些发现，但对于自然的很多方面还是未知的，D 选项符合文意。

questions.article:
Minimum and Maximum Depths of Stony Coral Species in Caribbean and Indo-Pacific Waters

Some scientists have suggested that as ocean temperatures rise, many fish and corals found in the shallow zone (less than 30 meters below the surface) could take refuge in the cooler, darker mesophotic zone (30 to 150 meters below the surface). However, it isn't clear that all such species will be able to tolerate mesophotic conditions. In 2018, Luiz Rocha and colleagues studied stony corals in the two zones in Caribbean and Indo-Pacific waters. Based on the depths at which those corals are now found, the species that seems least suited to a full migration to the mesophotic zone is ______
questions.question: Which choice most effectively uses data from the table to complete the statement?

options.name: A
options.content: Agaricia undata, because its minimum depth of 20 meters is in the shallow zone.

options.name: B
options.content: Plerogyra discus, because its maximum depth of 15 meters is furthest from the mesophotic zone.

options.name: C
options.content: Acropora echinata, because its maximum depth of 25 meters is close to but doesn't reach the mesophotic zone.

options.name: D
options.content: Psammocora albopicta, because its minimum depth of 1 meter is the shallowest of those listed.

questions.correct: Plerogyra discus, because its maximum depth of 15 meters is furthest from the mesophotic zone.
questions.solution:
A 选项 Agaricia undata，因为其最小深度 20 米在浅水区。
B 选项 Plerogyra discus，因为其最大深度 15 米离中层带最远。
C 选项 Acropora echinata，因为其最大深度 25 米接近但未达到中层带。
D 选项 Psammocora albopicta，因为其最小深度 1 米是所列中最浅的。
要选择最不适合完全迁移到中层带的物种，即其生存深度范围离中层带最远的。Plerogyra discus 的最大深度 15 米离中层带（30 - 150 米）最远，B 选项正确。

questions.article: The Harlem Renaissance, which gave us great literary works like May Miller's play The Bog Guide and nonliterary works like James Van DerZee's photograph Couple, Harlem, is often said to have ended in the 1930s shortly after the Great Depression began. But some scholars argue that the Harlem Renaissance never really ended because it continues to shape culture in the United States today. These scholars therefore suggest that ______
questions.question: Which choice most logically completes the text?

options.name: A
options.content: if a cultural movement has both literary and nonliterary innovations, then it is likely to be influential.

options.name: B
options.content: if a cultural movement is very innovative, then it is unlikely to be able to sustain itself for long.

options.name: C
options.content: if literary works of a cultural movement are influential, then it doesn't matter whether the unliterary works are.

options.name: D
options.content: if the influence of a cultural movement continues, then in some sense the movement itself continues.

questions.correct: if the influence of a cultural movement continues, then in some sense the movement itself continues.
questions.solution:
A 选项 “如果一个文化运动既有文学创新又有非文学创新，那么它很可能具有影响力。”
B 选项 “如果一个文化运动非常创新，那么它不太可能长久维持自身。”
C 选项 “如果一个文化运动的文学作品具有影响力，那么非文学作品是否有影响力就无关紧要了。”
D 选项 “如果一个文化运动的影响持续存在，那么在某种意义上这个运动本身就还在继续。”
文中提到一些学者认为哈莱姆文艺复兴的影响至今仍在，意味着它并没有结束，D 选项符合这种逻辑。

questions.article: Architects looking for inspiration may examine photographs of iconic buildings such as the Forbidden City in Beijing. A two-dimensional photograph, however, cannot capture how a building interacts with its surroundings, whether by complementing, blending in with, or perhaps even clashing with sights and activities nearby. An image of the Forbidden City thus ______
questions.question: Which choice most logically completes the text?

options.name: A
options.content: serves to exaggerate the building's historical importance.

options.name: B
options.content: fails to convey the full impact of the building's design and structure.

options.name: C
options.content: misrepresents how the building is perceived by people who have never visited Beijing.

options.name: D
options.content: conceals the subtle deterioration of the building's materials.

questions.correct: fails to convey the full impact of the building's design and structure.
questions.solution:
A 选项 “夸大了建筑的历史重要性。”
B 选项 “无法传达建筑设计和结构的全部影响。”
C 选项 “歪曲了从未去过北京的人对建筑的看法。”
D 选项 “掩盖了建筑材料的细微损坏。”
文中强调二维照片无法呈现建筑与周边环境的互动，这意味着无法完整呈现建筑的设计和结构带来的全部效果，B 选项符合逻辑。

questions.article: Some studies can be done well with relatively little money. For example, a marketing study simply trying to identify the average amount customers spend per transaction at an online retailer has a straightforward central question that doesn't require many years of data collection. But it is much more expensive to conduct a longitudinal study like the Household, Income and Labour Dynamics in Australia Survey (HILDA), which looks at data for 25,000 people in Australia to find trends in economic well-being that can take a long time to develop. This requires lots of funding because ______
questions.question: Which choice most logically completes the text?

options.name: A
options.content: marketing studies are not likely to require data from very many individuals.

options.name: B
options.content: data from 25,000 people may not be enough to reveal significant trends in economic well-being.

options.name: C
options.content: long-term trends in economic well-being are hard to find without collecting data over many years.

options.name: D
options.content: long-term trends in marketing can be found without examining many years of data.

questions.correct: long-term trends in economic well-being are hard to find without collecting data over many years.
questions.solution:
A 选项 “营销研究不太可能需要来自很多个体的数据。”
B 选项 “来自 25,000 人的数据可能不足以揭示经济福祉的显著趋势。”
C 选项 “如果不多年收集数据，很难发现经济福祉的长期趋势。”
D 选项 “不检查多年的数据也能发现营销的长期趋势。”
文中提到纵向研究需要大量资金，原因是发现经济福祉的长期趋势需要多年收集数据，C 选项符合逻辑。

questions.article: Some fuel additives contain cerium oxide nanoparticles (CeO2-NPs), which can leach into waterways and soils via wastewater. In a 2015 study, Mael Garaud and colleagues found that CeO2-NPs can accumulate in the bodies of zebra mussels (Dreissena polymorpha). While bioaccumulation of manufactured nanoparticles may be inherently worrisome, it has been hypothesized that CeO2-NP bioaccumulation in invertebrates like D. polymorpha could serve a valuable proxy role, obviating the need for manufacturers to conduct costly and intrusive sampling of vertebrate species such as rainbow trout (Oncorhynchus mykiss), commonly used in regulatory compliance testing for manipulative bioaccumulation, as environmental protection laws currently require.
questions.question: Which finding, if true, would most directly weaken the hypothesis presented in the text?

options.name: A
options.content: When D. polymorpha and O. mykiss are exposed to similar levels of CeO2-NPs, concentrations of CeO2-NPs in animals of both species show little variation from individual to individual.

options.name: B
options.content: The rate of CeO2-NPs uptake in D. polymorpha differs from the rate of CeO2-NPs uptake in O. mykiss in a way that is not yet well understood by researchers.

options.name: C
options.content: D. polymorpha has been shown to accumulate several other types of manufactured nanoparticles in addition to CeO2-NPs, whereas O. mykiss has been shown to accumulate only CeO2-NPs.

options.name: D
options.content: Compared with O. mykiss, D. polymorpha can accumulate detectable CeO2-NPs concentrations with significantly fewer negative effects.

questions.correct: The rate of CeO2-NPs uptake in D. polymorpha differs from the rate of CeO2-NPs uptake in O. mykiss in a way that is not yet well understood by researchers.
questions.solution:
A 选项 “当多形饰贝（D. polymorpha）和虹鳟鱼（O. mykiss）暴露于相似水平的 CeO2 - NPs 时，两种动物体内 CeO2 - NPs 的浓度在个体间差异很小。”
B 选项 “多形饰贝（D. polymorpha）摄取 CeO2 - NPs 的速率与虹鳟鱼（O. mykiss）摄取 CeO2 - NPs 的速率不同，研究人员对此还不太了解。”
C 选项 “多形饰贝（D. polymorpha）除了积累 CeO2 - NPs 外，还被发现积累其他几种人造纳米颗粒，而虹鳟鱼（O. mykiss）只被发现积累 CeO2 - NPs。”
D 选项 “与虹鳟鱼（O. mykiss）相比，多形饰贝（D. polymorpha）能在产生显著较少负面效应的情况下积累可检测到的 CeO2 - NPs 浓度。”
文中假设是无脊椎动物（如多形饰贝）体内的 CeO2 - NP 生物累积可以替代对脊椎动物（如虹鳟鱼）的测试，若多形饰贝摄取 CeO2 - NPs 的速率与虹鳟鱼摄取的速率不同且研究人员不了解这种差异，那么这种替代作用就存在问题，B 选项正确。

questions.article: Generally speaking, whether consumers give a good comment or a bad one is closely related to their expectations about the kind of service they will get. Some gas stations are located near schools while others are near restaurants. People who go to gas stations near schools usually get discounts for refueling their automobiles. However, such discounts are not provided at gas stations near restaurants. Recent studies show that the rate of good comments versus bad comments made to the gas stations near cafeteria is lower than the rate near schools, suggesting that ______
questions.question: Which choice most logically completes the text?

options.name: A
options.content: The number of people going to gas stations at restaurants is greater than that of people going to gas stations near schools.

options.name: B
options.content: People who go to gas stations at restaurants have higher expectations about the service because of higher price.

options.name: C
options.content: People are more willing to give good comments to gas stations near schools.

options.name: D
options.content: More gas stations should be established near schools.

questions.correct: People who go to gas stations at restaurants have higher expectations about the service because of higher price.
questions.solution:
A 选项 “去餐馆附近加油站的人数比去学校附近加油站的人数多。”
B 选项 “去餐馆附近加油站的人因为价格较高，对服务有更高的期望。”
C 选项 “人们更愿意给学校附近的加油站好评。”
D 选项 “应该在学校附近建立更多加油站。”
文中提到餐馆附近加油站没有折扣，且好评率低，可推测出因为价格高，人们对其服务期望也高，B 选项符合逻辑。

questions.article: Saeed M. Z. A. Tarabieh conducted a study of consumer attitudes toward Jordanian food and beverage companies and found that for consumers who value environmental conservation, their likelihood of purchasing a product decreased when their perception of the product's risk of causing environmental harm increased. Subsequently, other researchers conducted a study of various demographic groups in Turkey, investigating participants' intentions to purchase a new skincare product, and found that, on average, parents of small children had the lowest perception among all the demographic groups in the study of the environmental risks of the skin-care product. Assuming that the results of Tarabieh's study are broadly applicable, this finding suggests that ______
questions.question: Which choice most logically completes the text?

options.name: A
options.content: the new skin-care product is less appealing to parents of small children than other similar products on the market are.

options.name: B
options.content: there is not a meaningful difference in the average likelihood of purchasing environmentally friendly products among the demographic groups included in the study.

options.name: C
options.content: parents of small children likely prioritize other factors over a product's environmental sustainability when making purchasing decisions.

options.name: D
options.content: parents of small children might be more likely than participants in the other demographic groups to purchase the skin-care product.

questions.correct: parents of small children might be more likely than participants in the other demographic groups to purchase the skin-care product.
questions.solution:
A 选项 “新护肤产品对幼儿家长的吸引力不如市场上的其他类似产品。”
B 选项 “在研究中所包含的人口群体之间，购买环保产品的平均可能性没有显著差异。”
C 选项 “幼儿家长在做购买决策时可能会优先考虑产品的其他因素而非环境可持续性。”
D 选项 “幼儿家长可能比其他人口群体的参与者更有可能购买该护肤产品。”
文中提到幼儿家长对产品环境风险的认知度最低，结合之前的研究（对环境危害认知度低会增加购买可能性），可推断出幼儿家长更有可能购买该护肤产品，D 选项正确。

questions.article: During the American Civil War, Thomas Morris Chester braved the front lines as a war correspondent for the Philadelphia Press. Amplifying the voices and experiences of Black soldiers ______ of particular importance to Chester, who later became an activist and lawyer during the postwar Reconstruction period.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?
questions.solution:
A 选项 “were”（复数形式的过去时）；
B 选项 “have been”（现在完成时）；
C 选项 “are”（一般现在时）；
D 选项 “was”（单数形式的过去时）。
文中 “Amplifying the voices and experiences of Black soldiers”（放大黑人士兵的声音和经历）这一行为是单数概念，且时态为过去时，D 选项 “was” 符合语法规则。

questions.article: The first multi-player computer video game, Steve Russell's Spacewar!, challenged games' abilities not only to maneuver their spaceships but also to decide how best to utilize their limited weaponry so that they could defeat other Spacewar!'s ______ development, playing a video game was a more solitary experience in which one game player tried to beat a single computer.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?
questions.solution:
A 选项 “players, before”（“players” 后用逗号隔开，“before” 小写开头）；
B 选项 “players and before”（“players” 和 “before” 用 “and” 连接）；
C 选项 “players. Before”（“players” 后用句号隔开，“Before” 大写开头）；
D 选项 “players before”（“players” 和 “before” 直接相连）。
文中 “Spacewar! 's ___ development” 这里需要一个名词所有格形式，“Spacewar!” 是单数，“players” 需要用复数所有格来表示所属关系，且 “Before” 在句首需要大写，C 选项符合语法规则。

questions.article: To most observers, it might seem like the net-casting spider's small web consists of the same silk spun by other arachnids that make larger, fixed ______ the net casting spider uses a unique, stretchy silk to construct a net between its front legs that has more elasticity, enabling the net to expand tremendously when the spider lunges to capture prey. Biologist Jessica Garb and her research team hypothesize that this superior stretchiness comes from proteins in its silk.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

questions.article: Advancing a previous discovery by K. Barry Sharpless, chemist Carolyn Bertozzi—winner of the 2022 Nobel Prize in Chemistry alongside Sharpless and Morten Meldal—devised a method for the removal of toxic byproducts from click chemistry ______ healthy cells in humans for use in a variety of pharmaceutical treatments.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?
questions.solution:
A 选项 “to protect”（不定式形式）；
B 选项 “protected”（过去式或过去分词形式）；
C 选项 “and protecting”（并列的现在分词形式）；
D 选项 “protecting”（现在分词形式）。
文中 “a method for the removal of toxic byproducts from click chemistry ___ healthy cells in humans”，这里需要用不定式来表示目的，A 选项 “to protect” 符合语法规则。

questions.article: According to Maria Magdalena Llabre of the University of Miami, the reason that the rate of heart disease seems lower in US Hispanics than in their non-Hispanic white counterparts while similarly ______ is that the nature of the Spanish language better supports emotional expression, helping its speakers manage their stress responses.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?
questions.solution:
A 选项 “stressed”（一般过去时或过去分词形式）；
B 选项 “stressed,”（一般过去时或过去分词形式，后面有逗号）；
C 选项 “stressed;”（一般过去时或过去分词形式，后面有分号）；
D 选项 “stressed:”（一般过去时或过去分词形式，后面有冒号）。
文中 “while similarly ___” 这里需要一个动词形式，“similarly” 是副词修饰动词，“stressed” 符合语法规则，A 选项正确。

questions.article: The modern board game backgammon has its roots in the earliest identifiable tables game from the Byzantine Empire, tabula. In both games, the rules are the same for hitting a blot (landing on an occupied point) and bearing off (removing checkers from the board); re-entering one of the checkers into the game also ______ the same rules in backgammon as in tabula.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?
questions.solution:
A 选项 “follows”（一般现在时，单数形式）；
B 选项 “are following”（现在进行时）；
C 选项 “have followed”（现在完成时）；
D 选项 “follow”（一般现在时，复数形式）。
文中 “re - entering one of the checkers into the game also ___ the same rules”，主语是 “re - entering”（动名词作主语，视为单数），这里需要用一般现在时的单数形式，A 选项 “follows” 符合语法规则。

questions.article: The moon Leda orbits Jupiter in the same direction that the planet rotates. ______ Leda's orbit is described as prograde. Ananke, another of Jupiter's moons, orbits in the opposite direction, so its orbit is described with the opposite term: retrograde.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?
questions.solution:
A 选项 “In reality,”（实际上）；
B 选项 “Nevertheless,”（然而）；
C 选项 “Hence,”（因此）；
D 选项 “Next,”（接下来）。
文中前一句说明了木卫十三的轨道方向与木星自转方向相同，后一句说明了木卫十二的轨道方向与木星自转方向相反，前后存在因果关系，“Hence” 符合逻辑，C 选项正确。

questions.article: As part of a study, participants were asked to list animals they thought of as “charismatic,” which was defined as “attractive, fascinating, or appealing.” Researchers compiled the responses into a single list and found that the cheetah and the blue whale both landed in the top twenty. ______ no animal outranked the tiger.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?
questions.solution:
A 选项 “In other words,”（换句话说）；
B 选项 “As result,”（结果）；
C 选项 “Still,”（不过；仍然）；
D 选项 “For example,”（例如）。
文中前一句提到猎豹和蓝鲸排在前二十，后一句说没有动物排名超过老虎，存在转折关系，“Still” 符合逻辑，C 选项正确。

questions.article: Shonte Tucker has worked at NASA's famed Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL), one of the world's leading facilities for robotic space exploration. ______ Tucker worked as a systems engineer on the JPL's Mars 2020 Perseverance rover team, which improved upon the 2011 Curiosity rover design by adding a coring drill to the robot that could collect rock samples for later analysis.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?
questions.solution:
A 选项 “Conversely,”（相反地）；
B 选项 “Specifically,”（具体来说）；
C 选项 “Finally,”（最后）；
D 选项 “Nevertheless,”（然而）。
文中前一句提到塔克在喷气推进实验室工作，后一句具体说明了塔克在该实验室中的具体工作内容，“Specifically” 符合逻辑，B 选项正确。

questions.article: Superconductors, materials that transmit electricity without any resistance to the flow of the electric current, only work at extremely low temperatures. In a 2023 article, ______ asserts that researchers have made progress toward developing superconductors that can function at room temperature and still carry up to five times as much electricity as current cables.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?
questions.solution: A 选项 “physicist Mishkat Bhattacharya,”（“physicist” 后有逗号）；B 选项 “physicist, Mishkat Bhattacharya”（“physicist” 后有逗号，且 “Mishkat Bhattacharya” 前有逗号）；C 选项 “physicist Mishkat Bhattacharya”（无逗号）；D 选项 “physicist, Mishkat Bhattacharya,”（“physicist” 和 “Mishkat Bhattacharya” 后都有逗号）。这里 “physicist” 是对 “Mishkat Bhattacharya” 的职业说明，中间不需要逗号，C 选项符合语法规则。

questions.article: Stephanie Jenouvrier of the Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution asserts that when climate change results in sea ice abatement, emperor penguin chicks encounter fewer solid surfaces for required respite when they are not swimming, which increases their chance of drowning and thus endangers this species. If elevated temperatures continue, ______ Jenouvrier conducted a study to find the answer.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?
questions.solution:
A 选项 “these penguins could become extinct.”（陈述句）；
B 选项 “these penguins could become extinct?”（句末问号使用错误）；
C 选项 “could these penguins become extinct.”（句末无问号）；
D 选项 “could these penguins become extinct?”（一般疑问句）
文中这里是一个疑问句，“could these penguins become extinct?” 符合语法规则，D 选项正确。
